intro: Dubautia linearis, commonly known as the linear dudleya, is a species of flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a succulent shrub characterized by its fleshy, linear leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the dry, sunny conditions of its native habitat.
